oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Event-by-Event Fluctuation Studies in Pb-Pb Collisions at LHC Energy by the ALICE Experiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JENA, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: QUARK-GLUON PLASMA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The presence of phase transition can manifest itself by the characteristic behavior of several observables which may vary dramatically from one event to the other. Thus, the study of various conserved quantities on an event-by-event basis offers the possibility to study the phase transition and the nature of high density matter. The ALICE experiment is well suited for precise event-by-event measurements of various quantities. In this article, the event-by-event fluctuations of mean transverse momentum and net-charge distributions as measured by the ALICE experiment are presented.
